abstract: The Bank of England raised its key rate by a quarter point to 5.75 percent, while the European Central Bank left its benchmark interest rate at 4 percent.
snippet: The Bank of England raised its key rate by a quarter point to 5.75 percent, while the European Central Bank left its benchmark interest rate at 4 percent.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 5 — The Bank of England raised interest rates Thursday for the fifth time in a little less than a year, and the president of the European Central Bank, Jean-Claude Trichet, hinted at a possible rate increase later this year as policy makers around the world respond to the threat of accelerating inflation.

headline.main: Bank of England Raises Key Rate
headline.print_headline: Britain Raises Rates Again; Europeans Hint of Move
